title: Reading Lila - An Inquiry Into Morals - by Robert M. Pirsig - Chapter 21
description: It was obvious when the curlicues grew curlicues that the torch of Victorian morality was wavering. The moth headed for the moon was zapped into oblivion, its body coming to rest into a trench. And then the real fight began...
